description: We exited our fintech and focused on comparing organization playbooks and SOPs to actual team execution to predict where "the ball drops" before it hits revenue. All powered by metadata only
problem_statement:
Revenue drops when teams ignore playbooks and shift behavior:
 

60%
of mid-market companies don’t have playbooks or the teams don’t follow them
58%
slower revenue growth in organizations misaligned with corporate playbooks
18%
lower EBITDA at companies with poor strategic and cross-team misalignment

market_opportunity.justification:
Target customer: COO/Head of operations - HR team is the user and champion but we don't make them as the buyer
Market size: $100B+ globally, however, we are focused on $32M ARR during the next 2-4 years

product_differentiation.justification:
Competitors: Celosnis from a process assessment perspective, however, they analyze processes forgetting about people and agents. HR platforms - on;y HR approach without assessing how people and agents influence ROI
In-market since: 20+ pilots, $1.5M in contracted ARR, 7 months old company

go_to_market_traction.justification:
Traction: 20+ pilots, $1.5M in contracted ARR, won Touchbistro, HR.com, GSB Bank, Altrata, and others
Customers: 20+ and 27 in the pipeline. We are winning HR team as our champion, then with their help we get to COO. We are also looking into channel partnerships - HR.com is one of them. They are adopting our tech now but will also resell it to their clients
Pricing: Only pilots for now

founder_team_strength.justification:
Co-founders: https://www.linkedin.com/in/norenkodmitry/
https://www.linkedin.com/in/andrew-davydchuk-a9a61997/

Dmitry Norenko, CEO
Andrew Davydchuk, CTO
Tech team: Only in-house development - 20 guys from our previous fintech we got with us after acquisition to build the new company

strategic_fit.justification: Aligned with SV’s thesis around digital transformation and workforce innovation.

red_flags: SOC2 Type 2. Network among large HR companies to make them as our sales channels
Lack of network among HR and payroll companies

founder_profile.name:
[https://www.linkedin.com/in/norenkodmitry/
https://www.linkedin.com/in/andrew-davydchuk-a9a61997/

Dmitry Norenko](https://www.linkedin.com/in/norenkodmitry/)
highlights: Founder has demonstrated commitment to solving a real market pain, often with personal or domain-driven insight.
Team typically includes technical or domain-specific expertise relevant to their solution.
Backgrounds show a mix of startup, academic, or operator experience that informs their execution approach.

founder_impact_assessment: Originally, we started as the HR tech scoring people. But we realized that HR won't allow us to grow the check size - they are wonderful champions but not the best buyers. We pivoted into a rules alignment tool when HR remains at our core, but we have become more of an operational layer. Actually, even a fintech - we protect the revenue of the company

sector_fit.justification: Aligned with SV’s macro thesis on workforce transformation, digital enablement, and operational efficiency.

employer_ecosystem_leverage.justification: Could integrate into SV portfolio employer use cases or distribution channels—especially those focused on talent, productivity, or care delivery.

strategic_partner_amplification.justification: Potential partnerships with other SV-backed platforms and vendors targeting the same buyer.

acceleration_readiness.justification: Product and team are early but show clear focus, alignment, and testable GTM hypotheses. Well-positioned for structured SV support.

successes_and_areas_of_investigation.description: SOC2 Type 2. Network among large HR companies to make them as our sales channels
Lack of network among HR and payroll companies

category_comparison: Graphio.ai positions itself against legacy and niche solutions. Its competitive advantage is built on integration, UX, and customer-centric outcomes.

primary_competitors.name: Incumbent Providers
primary_competitors.description: Traditional solutions or services that lack personalization, automation, or modern UX.
primary_competitors.comparison: This company differentiates via digital-first, user-centric, or AI-driven design. This competitor often lacks the depth or product flexibility needed to address evolving employer or operational requirements.

primary_competitors.name: Point Solutions
primary_competitors.description: Niche vendors addressing one aspect of the problem.
primary_competitors.comparison: This company offers a more integrated or holistic experience. This competitor often lacks the depth or product flexibility needed to address evolving employer or operational requirements.

category_comparison_expanded.conclusion: Graphio.ai is positioned well in its category with a differentiated product. With further traction and partnerships, it could emerge as a category leader.

final_recommendation.rationale: Pending deeper review, financial validation, and external signal confirmation.
